meanings.definition: A coarse fabric of silk, wool, or silk and wool, often stiffened with gum.
meanings.sent1: The tailor used grogram to make a sturdy jacket.
meanings.sent2: She wore a beautiful dress made of grogram to the party.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat got tangled in the grogram curtains.
meanings.sent4: The grogram of the night sky was woven with twinkling stars.
meanings.sent5: The grogram fabric felt rough against his skin.

meanings.definition: A garment made of grogram fabric.
meanings.sent1: He admired the elegant grogram coat hanging in the store window.
meanings.sent2: She received many compliments on her grogram dress at the event.
meanings.sent3: The grogram robe made him look like a medieval king.
meanings.sent4: Her grogram attire stood out like a vibrant flower in a field of green.
meanings.sent5: The grogram garment was a perfect blend of style and comfort.
